p: Climate change is expected to increase average temperatures, but also the frequency and intensity of drought events [ 1]. Since drought can have negative effects on plant growth and survival [ 2], changes in drought regimes have implications for plant community structure and composition [ 3], ultimately affecting ecosystem functioning and services [ 4]. Extreme droughts have already caused significant forest diebacks around the globe [ 5] and declines in plant productivity across Europe [ 6]. In the future, we can expect that even areas that have been “safe” from drought so far, like the European Alps, will suffer more frequent and intense drought events [ 1].
